materials: Caron® Macchiato Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 481 yds/440 m) Sunny (71008) 1 ball or 345 yds/314 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: One Size to fit Adult. Approx 17" [43 cm] long.
instructions:
WRIST WARMER  (make 2 alike)
Notes: 
• Wrist Warmers are worked in the round (rnd), turning at end of each rnd to alternate Right Side (RS) and Wrong Side (WS).
• When working thumb opening, rnds are not joined and opening section is worked in rows.
Beginning (Beg) at top edge, ch 38. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first chain (ch) to form a ring, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. 38 sc.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
3rd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Repeat (Rep) last 2 rnds until Wrist Warmer measures 7" [18 cm], ending on a WS rnd.
Begin shaping: Decrease rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Single crochet 2 together (sc2tog). 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Next 5 rnds: Work even as before, turning at end of each rnd.
Rep last 6 rnds twice more. 32 sts remain (rem).
Continue (Cont) working even without decreases until Wrist Warmer measures 13½" [34.5 cm], ending on a WS rnd.
Divide for thumb opening (worked in rows): 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each stitch (st) around. Do not join. Turn.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
Close thumb opening (Return to working in rnds):
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rnds until Wrist Warmer measures 17" [43 cm]. Fasten off.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool DK Superwash™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 125 yds/114 m)
Contrast A Dark Grey Heather (12042) 3 balls
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] circumference x 20½" [51 cm] long.
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
Motif
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 3. 3 dc in ring) 3 times. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl to any ch-3 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join A with sl st to any ch-3 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same ch-3 sp as last sl st. *(Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Motif 1: Make 4 using E as Color 1 and F as Color 2.
Motif 2: Make 4 using D as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
Motif 3: Make 4 using C as Color 1 and D as Color 2.
Motif 4: Make 4 using F as Color 1 and C as Color 2.
Motif 5: Make 3 using C as Color 1 and E as Color 2.
Motif 6: Make 3 using B as Color 1 and F as Color 2.
FINISHING
Sew Motifs tog as per diagram. Fold where indicated. Sew side seams.
Top edging: 1st rnd: Join A with sl st to top edge of Stocking. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around top of Stocking. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop: With A, ch 31. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 30 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Attach Hanging Loop to top of Stocking.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (Solids: 7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m; Stripes: 5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
11/2" [4 cm] piece of cardboard for pompoms.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 19" [48 cm] long from cuff to toe.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
• To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of previous stitch and draw new color through.

Leg Stripe Pat
**With B, work 2 rnds.
With A, work 2 rnds.
Rep from ** to ** twice more.
With B, work 6 rnds.
***With A, work 2 rnds.
With B, work 2 rnds.***
Rep from *** to *** once more.
With A, work 2 rnds.
With B, work 3 rnds.
These 31 rnds form Leg Stripe Pat.

Foot Stripe Pat
With B, work 3 rnds. Join A.
**With A, work 2 rnds.
With B, work 2 rnds.**
Rep from ** to ** once more.
With A, work 2 rnds.
With B, work 6 rnds.
With A, work 1 rnd.
These 20 rnds form Foot Stripe Pat.

STOCKING
Cuff: With A, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 14" [35.5 cm] ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off. 
Join Cuff:  Working in back loops only, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Do not turn. 
Leg: Rotate to work along side edge of Cuff and proceed as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 46 sc evenly around side edge of Cuff. Join with sl st to first sc. Join B. Turn. 
Beg working Leg Stripe Pat.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd to 32nd rnds: Keeping cont of Leg Stripe Pat, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Leg Stripe Pat is complete.

Heel: 1st row:  (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 22 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 23 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row for 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape Heel: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 17 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 11 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 12 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 13 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 14 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 15 sts.
7th and 8th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 15 sts. 
Fasten off.

Foot
Joining rnd: (RS). Join B with sl st at left side of Heel Base. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc of instep. PM. Work 7 sc up right side of Heel, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc across end of Heel and 7 sc down left side of Heel. Join. 52 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to marker. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 50 sts.
First 2 rnds of Foot Stripe Pat are complete. 
Keeping cont of Foot Stripe Pat, rep 2nd rnd until 44 sts rem. 
6th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th to 20th rnds: Keeping cont of Foot Stripe Pat, rep 7th rnd.
Foot Stripe Pat is complete.

Shape toe: 1st rnd:  With A, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join. 40 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join. 36 sts.
3rd to 8th rnds:  Cont in same manner, dec 4 sts on every rnd until 12 sts rem. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

FINISHING
Hanging loop: With A, ch 25. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. Fold in half and sew in position at top center back of cuff as shown in photo.
Pompoms (make 9):  Wind B around 1 1/2 " [4 cm] piece of cardboard 100 times. Tie yarn tightly in the middle and leave long ends for attaching to Stocking. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth round shape.
Sew Pompoms evenly around base of Cuff as shown in photo.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Contrast A Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 221 yds/202 m
Red Heart® Bitty Stripes™ (10 oz/283 g; 515 yds/471 m) Contrast B Unicorn Mane (0115) 1 ball or 230 yds/210.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] long, excluding hanging loop.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = 5" [12.5 cm] from point to point.
instructions: Hexagon Motif (make 17). With B, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. Ch 1. (3 dc in ring. Ch 1) 5 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. [(3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1] 5 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. 3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to any corner ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off. FINISHING: With A, sew Hexagon Motifs tog as shown in diagram arranging Motifs for color changes worked with Contrast B to be randomly placed as shown in photo, matching A side with A side, B side with B side, C side with C side, etc. Note: Do Not join G to D and F to E accidentally where Motifs fold to form toe of stocking. Hanging Loop: Holding 3 strands total tog - 1 strand A and 2 strands B, join with sl st to top left of Stocking. Ch 15. Join with sl st to same sp as first sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Turqua (0512) 1 ball or 94 yds/85.5 m
Contrast B Pretty n’ Pink (0722) 1 ball or 24 yds/22 m
Contrast C Spring Green (0672) 1 ball or 32 yds/29 m
Contrast D Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 24 yds/22 m
Sizes U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc3tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in indicated space. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] wide x 12½" [32 cm] long.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Stocking is based on 1 Hexagon with extra rows along side and top edges.
• Toe edge has decreases for shaping.
• Final piece is folded and seamed along side, bottom and toe edges.
• Hexagon shape will become wavy as you progress and will not lay flat as it begins to grow. Do not worry if your piece does not lay flat before folding! Trust the process! 
VERSION 1 HEXAGON 
See Diagram on page 5. 
With C, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc at beg of this and subsequent rnds). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 5 times in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 6 groups of 3 dc and 6 ch-2 sps. Break C
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st in first ch-2  sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break B.
3rd rnd:  Join D with sl st in first ch-2  sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break D.
4th rnd: Join C with sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) twice. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) twice. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break C.
5th rnd:  Join A with sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. [*Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 5 times. Rep from * to * to end of rnd. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th and 7th rnds:  Sl st in each of next 2 dc and next ch-2  sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. [*Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 5 times. Rep from * to * to end of rnd. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
Break A at end of 7th rnd.
8th rnd: With C, as 5th rnd. Break C.
9th rnd:  Join D with sl st in first ch-2  sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 7 times. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp – PM in ch-2 sp just worked. Rep from * once more. **(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 7 times. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from ** twice more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 7 times. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break D. 
Shape toe: 10th rnd: Join B with sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 8 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next marked corner ch-2  sp. (Dc3tog in sp between next 2 groups of 3 dc) 8 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next marked corner ch-2 sp. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 8 times. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 8 times. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break B. 
PM in 4th corner ch-2 sp of 10th rnd.
Stocking Sides: 1st row:  With RS of Hexagon facing, join C with sl st in marked 4th corner ch-2 sp. 
Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. *(3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 9 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * once more. (3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 9 times. 3 dc in next corner ch-2 sp. Break C. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: (RS). Join A with sl st in top of ch 3 at beg of 1st row. Ch 3. 
*(3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 10 times. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * once more. (3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 10 times. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Break A.
PM in each of the two ch-2 corner sps of last row.
Stocking Top Edge: 1st row: With RS of Stocking facing, join A with sl st in first marked corner ch-2 sp. 
Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. (3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 11 times. 3 dc in second marked corner ch-2 sp. Turn.
2nd row:  (WS). Ch 3. (3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 12 times. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of ch 3. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Do not turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold Stocking with sides, bottom and toe edges aligned (see photo). Using matching shade, join sides, bottom edge and toe seams.
Hanging Loop:  Using 2 strands of A held tog, join with sl st to top edge at side seam. Ch 24. Join with sl st in seam. Fasten off.
VERSION 2 HEXAGON 
See Diagram on page 5. 
With C, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc at beg of this and subsequent rnds). 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 5 times in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 6 groups of 3 dc and 6 ch-2 sps. Break C
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break B.
3rd rnd:  Join D with sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) twice. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) twice. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break D.
5th rnd:  Join A with sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. [*Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 5 times. Rep from * to * to end of rnd. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
6th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. [*Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 5 times. Rep from * to * to end of rnd. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 
Break A.
7th rnd: Join C with sl st in first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. [*Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc.* Rep from * to * to next corner ch-2 sp. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 5 times. Rep from * to * to end of rnd. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break C.
8th rnd: With D, as 7th rnd. 
9th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and first ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 7 times. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2  sp – PM in ch-2  sp just worked. Rep from * once more. **(Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 7 times. Skip next 3 dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp. Rep from ** twice more. (Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in sp between next 2 groups of 3-dc) 7 times. Skip last 3 dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break D.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] long from cuff to heel.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Cuff: With B, ch 46. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care to not twist chain.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Join. Turn. 46 sc.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn.
Rep 2nd rnd, alternating RS and WS until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a WS rnd. Turn. Break B. Join A.
Leg: 1st rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from bottom of Cuff measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off.
Heel: With RS facing, join B with sl st to first sc.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 22 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row for 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape heel: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 15 sts. Fasten off at end of 8th row.
Joining rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st at left side of Heel Base. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc of instep. PM. Work 7 sc up right side of Heel, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc across end of Heel. Work 7 sc down left side of Heel. Join. 52 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to marker. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until 44 sts rem.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from joining rnd measures 5½" [14 cm].
Shape toe: 1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join.
Cont in same manner, dec 4 sts on every rnd until 12 sts rem. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.
Twisted Cord Loop: Cut 3 lengths of yarn, 16" [40.5 cm] long. Taking all strands tog, have someone hold one end or attach end to a hook. Twist strands to the right until they begin to curl. Fold 2 ends tog and tie in a knot so they will not unravel. The strands will now twist themselves tog. Sew to Stocking for hanging loop.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Contrast A Off White (10514) 1 ball or 227 yds/207 m
Contrast B Claret (10562) 1 ball or 158 yds/144 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all loop on hook.
Dc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2(3) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] wide at cuff x 21½" [54.5 cm] long.
instructions:
Notes:
• Stocking is worked side-to-side.
• Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc throughout.
FRONT
With A, ch 41. (See diagram on page 3.)
1st row: (WS). 2 dc in 4th ch from hook (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 40 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each dc to last 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 1 st inc’d.
3rd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 1st inc’d.
4th row: As 2nd row.
Rep last 2 rows 4 times more. 51 sts.
Shape Foot: 1st row: (RS). Ch 3. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 18 dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 21 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 3. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 20 sts
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to last 3 dc. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 19 sts.
4th row: Ch 3. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each dc to last 3 dc. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 17 sts.
5th row: Ch 3. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in each dc to last 5 dc. (Dc2tog) twice. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 13 sts.
6th row: As 5th row. 9 sts.
7th row: Ch 3. Dc2tog. Dc3tog. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last dc. 5 dc. Fasten off.
BACK
Work as given for Front noting RS and WS indications will be reversed. 
SURFACE SLIP STITCH STRIPES
Front: 1st Stripe: (RS). Join B with sl st at right side edge of Stocking at top of 2nd row. With yarn at WS of Front and working across top of 2nd row, sl st in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
2nd to 9th Stripes: Work as for First Stripe, working Surface Sl St stripes across top of every 2nd row.
Back: Work 1st to 9th Stripes as given for Front, noting opposite side of work will be RS.
Join Front and Back
Align Front and Back pieces with WS facing each other. At this point you can determine which side you wish to be the 'front' of Stocking, and which direction you wish the foot to point. Your chosen 'front' should be facing while working the Joining row. 
Joining row: (RS). Join A with sl st to top-left corner of Stocking. Working through both thicknesses, sc evenly down left side edge of Stocking, around foot and up right side edge of Stocking, working 3 sc in top-right corner. Do not fasten off. 
Top edging rnd: Work 23 sc evenly across top front of Stocking to first sc of Joining row. Sl st in first sc of Joining row. Turn stocking to 'back' and work 25 sc evenly across top back edge of Stocking. Join with sl st to center sc of 3 sc at top-right corner. Fasten off. 50 sc around top of Stocking.
Edging Slip stitch row: (RS). Join B with sl st to first sc of Joining row. Sl st in each sc to top right corner of Stocking. Fasten off.
CUFF
Note: Cuff is worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join rnds.
With WS of Stocking facing (looking at inside), join B with sl st to top right corner of Stocking. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Do not join.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in next sc, PM on this st for beg of rnd. 1 sc in each sc around. 
Rep last rnd, moving marker up each rnd until Cuff measures 2" [5 cm] long. Do not fasten off.
Next rnd (fold line): Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. 
Next rnd: 1 sc in next sc, PM on this st for beg of rnd. 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until Cuff from fold line measures 4" [10 cm] long. Do not fasten off.
Bobble Trim: *Sl st in each of next 4 sts. Bobble in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
Hanging Loop: With B, ch 18. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. 
Fold piece in half to form loop and sew ends to side edge of Cuff as shown.
